contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "will" and "forget" are understood to be part of the second phrase also. Alternate translation: "Will a virgin forget her jewelry, and will a bride forget her veils" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: Will a virgin forget her jewelry, a bride her veils

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "disappointed" is understood from the previous phrase. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "just as you were disappointed by Assyria" or "just as Assyria disappointed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: just as you were by Assyria

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is understood that this is what the people of Israel will say. Alternate translation: "The people will reply, 'Behold! We will come to you" or "You will say "Behold! We will come to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: Behold! We will come to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "are destroyed" are understood from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "my curtains are destroyed in a moment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: my curtains in a moment

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "will be taken" are understood from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "every old person heavy with years will be taken" or "they will take every old person heavy with years" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: every old person heavy with years

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "will be turned over to others" is understood from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "and their their fields and their women will also be turned over to others" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: both their fields and their wives together

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "will stumble" is understood from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "fathers and sons will both stumble" or "fathers and sons will both be hurt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: fathers and sons together

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood verb may be supplied. Alternate translation: "that neither they nor their ancestors have known" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: neither they nor their ancestors

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood verb may be supplied. Alternate translation: "teach each neighbor woman a funeral song" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: each neighbor woman a funeral song

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood verb may be supplied. Alternate translation: "or let the warrior take pride in his might" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: or the warrior in his might

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to while the person is running. Alternate translation: "If you fall down while running" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: If you fall down

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood information may be supplied. Alternate translation: "I will smash fathers and children together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: fathers and children together

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood information may be supplied. Alternate translation: "we hoped for a time of healing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: for a time of healing

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "then go and stand in all the other gates of Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: then in all the other gates of Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "will never perish" can be supplied to each of these phrases. This can also be expressed in positive terms. Alternate translation: "the law will never perish from the priests, and advice will never perish from the wise men, and words will never perish from the prophets" or "the priests will always have the law, the wise men will always give advice, and the prophets will always speak" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: the law will never perish from the priests, or advice from the wise men, or words from the prophets

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let people kill their men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their men be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let people kill their young men with swords in battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their young men killed by the sword in battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. The idiom "fall ... by the hand of" means to be killed by someone, with the word "hand" representing the whole person. Alternate translation: "I will enable those who want to kill them to kill them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: by the hand of the ones seeking their lives

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "the houses" may be supplied here. Alternate translation: "the houses of the kings of Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: of the kings of Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This sentence lists all who will be powerful and wealthy. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "he, his servants, and his people will ride into the palace on chariots and horses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: he, his servants, and his people

contextId.occurrenceNote: In verse 18, Yahweh stops speaking directly to Jehoiakim and begins to speak to other people. Here "lament" refers to grieving at Jehoiakim's death. Alternate translation: "They will not lament for Jehoiakim when he dies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: They will not lament for him

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may need to make this a complete sentence. Alternate translation: "Jeremiah should hide himself, too" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: Jeremiah, too

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "of the rule" are understood. Alternate translation: "in the fourth year of the rule of Jehoiakim" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: in the fourth year of Jehoiakim

contextId.occurrenceNote: The ideas of soldiers and going out to battle are understood from earlier in the sentence. They can be repeated. This command can also be addressed directly to the soldiers. Alternate translation: "you soldiers from Lud, who are skillful at bending your bows, go out to battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: Ludim, men skillful at bending their bows

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is understood "Gather together" is the beginning of the messenger's message. Alternate translation: "to tell the nations, 'Gather together ... for battle.'" or "to the nations, and he will tell them, 'Gather together ... for battle.'" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: to the nations, 'Gather together ... for battle.'
